channel.title: Random Text popping up "Hacked your runescape account" "Nice bank, lol"
channel.description:
Hey ppl i know he didnt hack my runescape account
but still his messages jsut popping up ritght up into my screen.
i think this is a trojan cuz hes into my pc, but i did a computer scan
on my C:// And deleted all corrupted files.... and he is still here
what should i do?
the messages looks like this
[img]http://i42.servimg.com/u/f42/16/52/06/54/rs_acc10.png[/img]

item.title: Random Text popping up "Hacked your runescape account" "Nice bank, lol"
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

it was destiny or innovationX of mod drizzy, but i guess destiny cuz it was a kinda huge server+client

Also got it fixed by readin the topic Virus of superman05

Read full topic
item.source: Random Text popping up "Hacked your runescape account" "Nice bank, lol"

item.title: Random Text popping up "Hacked your runescape account" "Nice bank, lol"
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

What was the server called? If it’s the same one I got infected from I can help you remove it. (Luckly I knew it was a virus and didn’t log onto rs)

Edit: I belive this is the same server that other people have been getting infected by. You can Remove the virus’s by doing the following Steps.

1.Make sure you can view Hidden Folders (If you don’t know how,Google it)
2.Go to YourUser/AppData/Roaming
3.You will see a file named AutoRestarter.exe, a file named YourUserlog and possibly a few other files. You will also see a Folder called WinDir.
4.You then want to remove the Folder WinDir, along with the following files I listed above.
5.Go into start and type msconfig
6.Go to Startup and disable something like MsnMsger (I forget the exact file name)
7.After the files are deleted Restart your computer.
8.You SHOULD be clean now. Im not 100% sure as im not sure if im clean yet. But it has been almost 2 days and my Runescape Account is yet to be hacked, and I never got one of those popups.

Read full topic
